title: 105_hr2421
content: The Military Selective Service Act is repealed. The Military Selective Service Act is repealed, and assets, contracts, property, and records held by the Selective Service System will be transferred to the Administrator of General Services. The Office of Selective Service Records will not be reestablished, and employees will be assisted in transferring to other positions in the executive branch. Conforming amendments will be made to Title 5 of the United States Code. The Immigration and Nationality Act is amended by removing references to specific sections and making adjustments to certain subparagraphs. The Immigration and Nationality Act is amended by removing specific sections and adjusting subparagraphs in Title 10 of the United States Code. The Immigration and Nationality Act is amended by removing specific sections and adjusting subparagraphs in Title 10 of the United States Code, including inserting "or" at the end of subparagraph (E), striking out subparagraph (F), and redesignating subparagraph (G) as subparagraph (F). Other changes include removing certain clauses in sections 651(a), 1475(a)(5), 12103(b), and 12103(d) related to military service and induction. The Immigration and Nationality Act is amended by removing specific sections and adjusting subparagraphs in Title 10 of the United States Code related to military service and induction under the Military Selective Service Act. The Immigration and Nationality Act is amended by removing sections related to military service and induction under the Military Selective Service Act. This includes changes in section 12647 regarding assignment to the Selective Service System. Title 22, 26, 29, and 37 of various Acts are amended by removing or redesignating certain sections. For example, Title 22 repeals a section, Title 26 amends a section related to service duty, Title 29 removes and redesignates subsections, and Title 37 eliminates a sentence in a specific section. Title 37 of the United States Code is amended by removing a sentence in section 209(a) and making changes to section 308e(1). Additionally, Title 42 is amended by changing sections related to Social Security and Legal Services Corporation Act. The Act amends 42 U.S.C. 2996f(b) by replacing paragraph (10) to provide legal assistance for desertion from the Armed Forces. The Act and its amendments will take effect 180 days after enactment.
